intro: Pimpinella crinita, commonly known as the curly cow-wheat, is a herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in early spring. It often grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Pimpinella crinita is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
